name: v3.4.1
body:
* Enforce HSTS on all endpoints
* Log access to public dir (to console)
* Collect metrics of the root endpoint

name: v3.4
body:
* Update dependencies to newer versions
* Env config using flag names
* Add support for HTTP/2
* Add support for HSTS
* Update documentation

name: v3.3
body:
* Read configs from env
* New build using Go 1.9
* Add windows build (experimental)

name: v3.2
body:
- Add support for automatic TLS setup using LetsEncrypt.org
- Add support for TCP fast-open and Naggle
- Add support for multiple domains for CORS

name: v3.1.5
body: Add support for paid updates from MaxMind.

name: v3.1.4
body: Fix default listen address, page layout, and other minor details.

name: v3.1.3
body: Add JSONP back, make log prefixes optional.

name: v3.1.2
body: Fix for lat/long.

name: v3.1.1
body: Updated front-end.

name: v3.1.0
body: Update base package and http server.

name: v3.0.11
body: Bugfix for not exposing the filesystem unless explicitly configured.

name: v3.0.10
body:
Fix redis quota expiration
Remove playbook from binary releases

name: v3.0.9
body: Fix for Windows users.

name: v3.0.8
body: Updated server metrics and binary releases now include the sample ansible playbook.

name: v3.0.7
body: New features and bug fixes.

name: v3.0.5
body:
Fix CORS headers, build with Go 1.5.

Drop support for linux/386, add support for freebsd/amd64 for pre-compiled binaries.

name: v3.0.4
body: Add support for -redis-timeout flag.

name: v3.0.3
body: This release contains fixes for memory leaks when running the server with the -silent flag, a bug fix for the management of the temporary directory where the IP database is downloaded when -db points to a URL, and the addition of the -pprof command line flag for enabling remote profiling of the server.

name: v3.0.2
body: More fixes and the addition of the -version command line flag.

name: v3.0.1
body: Bug fixes and adjustments.

name: v3.0
body:
New version of the freegeoip web server.

Changes:
- Configuration file is gone. All switches are in the command line now.
- The updatedb script is gone. Now the server does some background job
  to download and maintain the database file up to date.
- Auto-reload of the database. If you update or overwrite the database
  file the server reloads it automatically with no service interruption.
- Single file front-end. No longer serving any JS or CSS, using it all
  from the cloud. jQuery is gone and the front-end is based on AngularJS
  and Bootstrap only.
- No more DNS contention. If you're running your own server and need
  that then use something external, like dnsmasq.
- Database date is exposed to clients in the X-Database-Date header.
- Preliminary IPv6 support. Closes #21.
- Localized country, region and city names. The server uses the
  Accept-Language header to determine the language of the response.
- Official docker support. See the Dockerfile for details.
- New package freegeoip for Go. All the above and more tidbits in a Go
  package that other programs can leverage.

This version of the freegeoip web server is backwards compatible with
the previous version. The HTTP API is virtually the same.
